1.0  Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies



This Risk Management Plan (RMP) is part of the SI Group USA (USA), LLC (SI Group) continuing commitment to minimize the potential impact from our facility on our workers, our community neighbors, or the environment. Our company is committed to operating safe and environmentally sound chemical production facilities everywhere we do business.  Protection of our neighbors and workers is the highest priority.  This ongoing commitment to worker and public safety is demonstrated through resources invested for safe design, operation, and maintenance of our facilities.  It is the stated policy of SI Group to safely manage our site operations. The policy is signed by top management. In addition, we have prepared contingency plans to be used in the unlikely event that a major accident should occur.  The facility is a certified Responsible Care facility.  Responsible Care is a technical standard for management of Environmental, Health, Safety and Security risks associated with our operations.  We believe it is important for all interested parties to have access to information that can help them better understand our business and our facility.  If you have any questions about this document, or any other aspect of our company or our plans, please contact our Environmental Health, Safety and Security Manager at (304) 284-2380 or Environmental Engineer at 304-284-2214. 



We are committed to comply with governing laws, regulations, and engineering standards as well as systematic assessments to manage and maintain a safe operation.  Our operating practices and procedures ensure that numerous controls are implemented to prevent an accidental release of a chemical.  However, if a major release does occur, our trained on-site emergency response team will be activated.

5.0  EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



The facility maintains a written emergency response program designed to protect workers, the public, and the environment in the event of a major accidental release.  The Emergency Response Team (ERT) is trained in the proper response to an incidents including HazMat Technician Training, Confined Space Training, Emergency Medical Res ponders, and Incident Command System. We also invest in the equipment needed to respond to on-site emergencies.  The EHS Department personnel are members of the Local Emergency Planning Committee.  Ongoing training exercises with the ERT and External Response Agencies are important to the company's emergency response organization and help better prepare our partners in the community for emergency response necessary in the unlikely event of a major industrial incident.



Information about how to shelter yourself and your family in the event of a chemical emergency can be found in the local telephone directory and on the Monongalia County Office of Emergency Management's web page at http://www.moncooem.org/. 



As consistent with the Monongalia County Emergency Response Plan, SI Group will work through the Monongalia County Emergency Management Commission to communicate any appropriate actions to be taken by the public in the event of a chemical emergency.
